reviews.text: Our first experience of the Big easy coming from the Uk and we picked the hotel based on location in relation to distance from the french quarter and price which was decent value.
reviews.title: Top class

reviews.text: From the minute we arrived there staff made us feel very valued and were full of useful information.
reviews.title: The Hotel entrance is on COMMON ST.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was immaculate and there was always fresh coffee and iced water available.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wifi was free and the room was big and tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: Just returned

reviews.text: The pool was big enough and very clean.
reviews.title: Love the N.O. JW!

reviews.text: This was a hotel that I got a good deal on Priceline. I had never used priceline before so I was nervous about the hotel. It turned out to be one of our best trips to New Orleans ever. The location is perfect, you are within walking distance of just about everything and the trolley systems pass very close by if you can't walk. The staff were beyond helpful, especially Zach. He overheard me telling my husband how much I loved the bath products and I found a whole bag of them in my room later that day. He kept a container full of ice and bottled water in our room the whole weekend. I would go back to NOLA just to stay here again!
reviews.title: Loved it! This was the best stay EVER!

reviews.text: Stayed here from Jan. 3-7, 2013, for a conference in town. I'm giving the hotel 4 stars for service, but the room was very underwhelming. The bathroom was tiny and outdated. Didn't see a shower cap. On my first night, I kept hearing noises all night. At first, I thought I had very active neighbors, but I soon realized that no one is that active. It sounded like a mechanical noise coming from the ceiling. The club floor was right above me so perhaps a machine there was acting up. Regardless, after like no sleep, I called and they moved me to another room. I expect nothing less from Marriott. Plus, they gave me free breakfast. The room service menu said the hot chocolate came with whipped cream. But, all that arrived was a pot of hot water and a couple packets of powder hot chocolate. Rather lazy effort. The bellhop who moved me rooms said that 4 people had complained to him just that morning about noise.
reviews.title: Ok, but not great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not have any noise problems in the second room. My husband and I were not feeling 100% as we were both battling a stomach bug. Even though we had the "do not disturb" sign on the door, housekeeping kept knocking on the door to clean the room. Isn't the point of the sign to leave us alone?
reviews.title: Simply the best.

reviews.text: Overall, hotel was in a good location. You could hear some street noise even from high floors.
reviews.title: Great hotel but billing problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the JW Marriott for my birthday. Upon my arrival I was greeted with warmth and birthday wishes at the front desk. I am a Marriott rewards member and was upgraded to a beautiful corner suite on the 29th floor with a view of Canal St, the French Quarter and Mississippi River. Next a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and bottle of champagne was delivered to my room. For the rest of my staff the staff in the concierge, front desk or just passing in the hallway were all extremely friendly and hospitable. The JW Marriott in New Orleans is a beautiful property. This by far one of the best hotel stays I in my book (I am on business travel twice a month).
reviews.title: Canal Street

reviews.text: The staff of the JW Marriot was wonderful during our recent trip to New Orleans. From front desk, concierge, housekeeping, to doormen, all staff went out of their way to be helpful. The hotel was super clean and the location is great for so many venues in New Orleans, especially if you are on foot. It is very close to many wonderful restaurants.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.text: This Marriott is an excellent facility in a superb location in New Orleans. New Orleans has gone to great measures to improve itself after hurricane Katrina. Very nice facility, very clean, very modern
reviews.title: Excellent central location in New Orleans, easy to walk almost everywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went here after a very bad experience at a different hotel in new oreans (see review of Hotel St Marie). Due to this we arrived late and grumpy.
reviews.title: Great Place - Treated as valuable Customer

reviews.text: They turned this around quickly! From the polite valet car driver to entering and staff giving us a refresher tower and a drink during check in because we looked a bit grumpy!
reviews.title: Warm and friendly

reviews.text: The room was clean and modern with a comfortable bed and a great view of the city. Also it was only 20USD more expensive than the hotwire rate we had at the very bad Hotel St Marie.
reviews.title: Successful business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a wonderful stay at this hotel. As usual, the service level is above and beyond excellent. It is our hotel of choice when in New Orleans. It is right in the middle of the action for the Mardi Gras parades and the security kept the lobby for hotel guests only and we truly appreciated that. Our room was facing Canal street so we could see some of the parades from our window. Schula's restaurant in the hotel is always top notch, we always get their breakfast buffet which is most excellent. They have remodeled the lobby area and lounge since our last visit and I have to say it is beautiful. Not sure if it is modern or cosmopolitan decor but it is very lovely. The staff here knows how to treat you and the bellmen always remember you! Love this place.
reviews.title: Always excellent!

reviews.text: I spent a week at this JW Marriott Hotel and was very disappointed. You fully expect a room that runs $175 per night to have a mini fridge. The office chair looked to be one from the 60's, not very comfortable and cushions made out of vinyl. The bathroom was a total disappointment. Very old and not taken care of. The spout on the tub was hanging on by a thread. There was very little water pressure coming out of the shower. May have been due to the leak at the junction between the two shower heads. The sink in the bathroom had hardly no room to place accessories. There at least should have been a shelving unit beside the sink to place a shaving kit, toothbrush, hair brush, etc. The wireless internet was not very reliable. Thankfully, I had a MiFi device that took care of internet needs. I have recommended to my company not to go back to this hotel for business travel. On the positive side, the bed was very comfortable and the HD TV received a good variety of HD channels. Shula's is a fantastic restaurant which is located inside the hotel.
reviews.title: Expected more from a JW

reviews.text: My husband and I took our mothers to New Orleans as a "Sorry we ran off and got married" gift. When we got there, we realized it was the first weekend of Mardi Gras #win! Staying at the JW Marriot was a brilliant idea! The location was superb! The service was wonderful. We got there at 1pm (3 hours before check-in) and they had our rooms ready. The rooms were super nice and clean. The service was great. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. We could even watch the parades from our room windows, but we were on the parade gate! Our mothers had a fantastic time. I think it's safe to say we are forgiven for eloping. When we got ready to leave, I realized I'd left my purse in the hotel room. One of the security guys went up to the room with me and opened the door so that I could get my purse. Everyone was extremely nice! And we got the rooms for a great price ($85/night). When we go back to NOLA, JW Marriott will be the first place we check.
reviews.title: The absolute best choice!!!

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in the JW Marriott and found it to be clean and convenient. It is easy to find off the interstate and just barely a 5 minute walk into the French Quarter. We were in town for the Basketball and it wasn't even too far to walk to the stadium. We did have noisy neighbours (no fault of the hotel) but when we complained to reception around 11.45p.m. it was clearly dealt with as we were able to drift off to sleep and awoke the next morning to find a letter shoved under the door apologising for the inconvenience. We would definitely consider staying at the JW next time we're in town.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The JW Marriott is a top notch hotel in every way. Very attentive service staff, business traveler level quality of accommodations and amenities. Not overly expensive, but this is not at all a budget hotel. You will have to pay a hefty fee for parking each night if you have a car. Location is on Canal Street, which borders the French Quarter on one side, and the Central Business District on the other side. Within "city walking" distance of the Morial Convention Center, Harrah's Casino, the Aquarium, Mississippi river excursions and the ferry that takes you across the river to Mardi Gras World. The in-hotel restaurant is Shula's steakhouse - I only ate breakfast there, but it was superb both days.
reviews.title: Best of New Orleans
